DataElement.preferredName: Adjuvant Postoperative Targeted Therapy Agent Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to identify an adjuvant postoperative targeted molecular therapy agent administered to an individual. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the therapeutic application of radiation to treat disease following surgery to remove tumor and associated malignant tissue._Cancer therapies which use drugs to act upon specific molecules, metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Agents given to augment or stimulate a primary therapy or alleviate adverse effects caused by the primary therapy.(NCI):After surgery.:The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.

Concepts.definition: An agent that enhances the activity or therapeutic effect of another pharmacologic substance without having much, if any, therapeutic impact by itself.
Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.

Property.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent or drug that has been administered to the patient.
